intro: Rhinanthus glaber var. serotinus, commonly known as the late common tickseed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. This variant is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom later in the season compared to other Rhinanthus species. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, and its flowers are arranged in dense spikes.
